lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm iDAwn pUrn bHm igAwn pUrn Bgiq siqgur aupdys hY
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Dhiaan Pooran Braham Giaana , Pooran Bhagati Satigur Oupadays Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Satguru's sermon (in the form of blessing of Naam) is complete contemplation of the Master Lord, His knowledge and is total worship.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy jl Awpw Koie brn brn imlY qYsy hI ibbykI prmwqm p√çys hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jal Aapaa Khoi Baran Baran Milai , Taisay Hee Bibaykee Paramaatam Pravays Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As water mixes with several colours and acquires the same hue, similarly a disciple following Guru's advice becomes one with God.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs pris jYsy kink Aink Dwqu cMdn bnwspqI bwsnw Avys hY
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Parasi Jaisay Kanik Anik Dhaatu , Chandan Banaasapatee Baasanaa Avays Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: As many metals when touched with philosopher stone become gold, bushes and plants grown in the vicinity of sandalwood attain its fragrance, similarly a devotee following Guru's advice becomes pure and one who spreads the fragrance of goodness all around.

lines.gurmukhi: Git Git pUrm bHm joiq Eiq poiq BwvnI Bgiq Bwie Awid kau Adys hY ]133]
lines.transliteration_english: Ghati Ghati Pooram Braham Joti Aoti Poti , Bhaavanee Bhagati Bhaai Aadi Kau Adays Hai ?133?

Shabad OS B.translation: Making prayers and supplications to the Almighty Lord, a wise and rationalist person enjoins the divine radiance of the Omnipresent Lord like warp and weft of a fabric through complete faith and devotion instilled in him by the Guru. (133)
